articles.title: American Heart Association awards cash grants to social entrepreneurs to address health inequities - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: Approximately 50 million people in the United States are at higher risk for heart disease and/or stroke because they lack the most basic needs -; healthy food, clean air and drinking water, quality education, employment, housing and access to health care.

articles.title: 7 Million Have Undetected Mild Cognitive Impairment - Newsmax
articles.description: Millions of older Americans may be unaware they have memory and thinking impairments - mostly because their doctors aren't diagnosing them, new research suggests. After analyzing Medicare data covering 40 million older Americans, researchers found that only a…
